cont.entity_a: The camera lens develops spots over time, affecting image quality. Limited by the kit lens, but it's a good starting point. Bundled lens is adequate; 17-85mm EFS IS lens recommended for flexibility.
cont.entity_b: Produces sharp images with a good lens.

cont.entity_a: The camera body has a good feel. Solid build with a heavy metal body. Camera body and controls are solid and well-placed.
cont.entity_b: Heavier than newer models. Workhorse build.

cont.entity_a: Battery lasts long; a second battery is recommended. Battery life is impressive, but the compartment door is flimsy. Battery compartment door catch is fragile.
Produces great pictures even after 10 years. Above average low noise performance at ISO1600. 8 megapixel resolution allows large print sizes.
cont.entity_b: Produces sharp images with a good lens. Excellent low ISO performance. Workhorse build and outstanding image quality.

cont.entity_a: Subsecond latency captures action shots effectively. Does not support video recording. Advanced control algorithms. Ease of use allows more focus on creativity. Rapid shooting feature is effective for action shots. Fast autofocus and excellent for photojournalism. Good automatic mode for quick shots. High-quality images with potential for creative control.
cont.entity_b: Performs well as a backup camera. Works flawlessly as an older professional body.

cont.entity_a: Compatible with older Canon lenses. Limited support for 64-bit operating systems. Great camera but lacks support for newer operating systems.
Impressive feature list for its price.
cont.entity_b: Price is high compared to newer models like D3.

cont.entity_a: Above average low noise performance at ISO1600.

cont.entity_b: Smaller review screen compared to newer models.
Not as good as the D300 in picture quality.
